tit.cmt: 6行目でカッコ内の内容（deep-fried tofu）が出てくるため、ここでは外しました。

sen.j: 厚揚げ（あつあげ）は、1丁から半丁程度に切った豆腐を油で揚げた食品。
sen.e: Atsuage is a food made by deep-frying tofu (bean curd) cut into a piece or half a piece.
Atsuage is a food made by deep-frying tofu (bean curd) cut into one piece or half a piece.
Atsuage is a food made by deep-frying tofu (bean curd) cut into one piece or half a piece.

sen.j: 生揚げ（なまあげ）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called namaage.
It is also called namaage.
It is also called namaage.
A kind of deep-fried tofu.
A kind of deep-fried tofu.
A kind of deep-fried tofu.

sen.j: 油揚げのように、切り分けたり、加工して使うことはあまりせず、そのままの大きさで暖めてショウガ醤油で食べたり、おでんの具材にしたりすることが多い。
sen.e: In Japan an atsuage is not usually cut into pieces or cooked as an abura-age (deep-fried bean curd) is, but are simply warmed in the original size and served with grated ginger and soy sauce, or used as an ingredient of oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, etc.).

In Japan an atsuage is not usually cut into pieces or cooked as an abura-age (deep-fried bean curd) is, but are simply warmed in the original size and served with grated ginger and soy sauce, or used as an ingredient of oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, etc.).

In Japan an atsuage is not usually cut into pieces or cooked as an abura-age (deep-fried bean curd) is, but are simply warmed in the original size and served with grated ginger and soy sauce, or used as an ingredient of oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, etc.).

sen.j: また、厚揚げは、油揚げ（薄揚げ）とは違い、中は柔らかいため生揚げと呼ばれる場合もある。
sen.e: As atsuage is soft inside unlike abura-age (usuage), it is sometimes called namaage (raw deep-fried food).
As atsuage is soft inside unlike abura-age (usuage), it is sometimes called namaage (raw deep-fried food).
As atsuage is soft inside unlike abura-age (usuage), it is sometimes called namaage (raw deep-fried food).

sen.j: また、絹ごし豆腐を使用したものは「絹厚揚げ」と呼ばれ、通常の厚揚げよりもかなり柔らかい。
sen.e: An atsuage made of fine-grained tofu (kinugoshidofu) is called "kinuatsuage" and is much softer than normal atsuage.
sen.cmt: 「絹厚揚げ」と呼ばれる由来をわかりやすくするため、(kinugoshidofu)を補足しました。
sen.e: An atsuage made of fine-grained tofu (kinugoshidofu) is called "kinuatsuage" and is much softer than normal atsuage.
An atsuage made of fine-grained tofu (kinugoshidofu) is called 'kinuatsuage' and is much softer than normal atsuage.

sen.j: 作り方は、しっかり水を切った豆腐を半丁程度に切り、180℃から200℃の高温の油で揚げる。
sen.e: To make atsuage, cut tofu into halves after draining well, and deep-fry in the oil of 180C to 200C.
To make atsuage, cut tofu into halves after draining well, and deep-fry in the oil of 180C to 200C.
To make atsuage, cut tofu into halves after draining well, and deep-fry in the oil of 180C to 200C.

sen.j: 表面が濃いキツネの入った言葉一覧料理になったら、油から上げる。
sen.e: Once the tofu is brown in color and becomes a dish of listed word, remove the tofu from the oil.
sen.cmt: 原文ミスの可能性があります。「濃いキツネ色になったら」ではないかと思われます。その場合「…and becomes a dish of listed word」を削除する必要があります。
sen.e: Once the tofu is brown in color and becomes a dish of listed word, remove the tofu from the oil.
Once the tofu is brown in color, remove the tofu from the oil.
sen.cmt: webを参照に、リンク先のand becomes a dish of listed wordを除去しました。

sen.j: 中華料理でも類似の豆腐を油で揚げた「炸豆腐」(ジャードウフ、ピンイン)、「豆腐泡」(ドウフパオ、)、「豆卜」(ドウブー、)などと呼ぶものを食材として利用している。
sen.e: Chinese dishes also use similar deep-fried tofu, including d zha dou fu, doufu pao, and dou bu.
sen.cmt: 炸豆腐（インターネット上は様々なスペルが検索ヒットしました）：http://www.statemaster.com/encyclopedia/Tofu→zha doufu（採用）http://www.ifoodmart.com/CuisineArticles/ChineseNewYear/LoHanJai.aspx→chow doufuhttp://tw.classf0001.urlifelinks.com/css000000054652/cm4k-1237455053-9106-8092.doc→Ziaa doufu豆腐泡：http://rabbitholewonderland.blogspot.com/（サイト上はdofuとなっていましたが、他に合わせてdoufuとしました）豆ト：http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tofu（wikipediaですがこれしか見当たらず採用しました）
sen.e: Chinese dishes also use similar deep-fried tofu, including dzha dou fu, doufu pao, and dou bu.
Chinese dishes also use similar deep-fried tofu, including dzha dou fu, doufu pao, and dou bu.

sen.j: 多くは1辺が数センチ程度の立方体や直方体に切った豆腐を揚げており、大きなかたまりのものは稀である。
sen.e: Many of them are deep-fried tofu cut into cubes and cuboids of a few centimeters on sides and big chunk is rarely seen.
Many of them are deep-fried tofu cut into cubes of a few centimeters in size and big chunks are rarely seen.
Many of them are deep-fried tofu cut into cubes of a few centimeters in size and big chunks are rarely seen.

sen.j: また、豆腐を直接揚げるのではなく、いったん植物の発酵液に漬け込んで、風味を付けてから油で揚げる「臭豆腐」(チョウドウフ)という食材もしくは料理がある。
sen.e: There is a food or a dish called chou do fu made by soaking tofu in fermentation liquor to add flavor and then deep-frying.
There is a food or a dish called chou do fu made by soaking tofu in fermentation liquor to add flavor and then deep-frying.
There is a food or a dish called chou do fu made by soaking tofu in fermentation liquor to add flavor and then deep-frying.

tit.cmt: http://www.skyscrapercity.com/showthread.php?t=759334&page=2（掲載されているのは他の食べ物のようですが、読みは同じものと考え採用しました。）

sen.e: A local dish of Guizhou.
A local dish of Guizhou.
A local dish of Guizhou.

sen.j: 正方形の油揚げを網で炙り、間に切れ込みを入れて、唐辛子味噌や刻みネギを挟んで食べる、激辛料理。
sen.e: A very spicy dish made by roasting square abura-age, slitting it up, and filling in hot pepper paste or finely-chopped leaks.
A very spicy dish made by roasting square abura-age, slitting it up, and filling in hot pepper paste or finely-chopped leaks.
A very spicy dish made by roasting square abura-age, slitting it up, and filling in hot pepper paste or finely-chopped leaks.

sen.j: =- 広東省の潮州料理などで作られる,おでんに似た煮込み料理の具のひとつとして用いる。
sen.e: Used as an ingredient of a stewed dish like oden made in Chiu Chow, Guangdong, China.
Used as an ingredient of a stewed dish like oden made in Chiu Chow, Guangdong, China.
Used as an ingredient of a stewed dish like oden made in Chiu Chow, Guangdong, China.

sen.j: - 台湾台北県淡水鎮の名物料理。
sen.e: A famous local dish of Tamsui, Taipei, Taiwan.
sen.cmt: 「淡水」のスペルは他にDanshuei, Danshuiなどがありましたが、「淡水、XXX、taiwan」でGoogle検索してもっともヒット件数の多かったTamsuiを採用しました。
sen.e: A famous local dish of Tamsui, Taipei, Taiwan.
A famous local dish of Tamsui, Taipei, Taiwan.

sen.j: 漢字の料理名は日本の「揚げ」を音訳している。
sen.e: The name of dish is a transliteration from Japanese "age (fry)".
The name of dish is a transliteration from Japanese "age (fry)."
The name of dish is a transliteration from Japanese 'age (fry).'

sen.j: 丸い油揚げをくりぬいて、中に味付けした春雨や筍などの具を詰め、独特の甘辛いたれをかけたもの。
sen.e: It is a round abura-age filled with fillings such as seasoned harusame (beanstarch vermicelli) and bamboo shoots and served with unique sweet-spicy sauce.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・用語集記載の訳「harusame (Spring Rain)」は食べ物を指す訳ではないとみなし、左記の訳としました。
sen.e: It is a round abura-age filled with fillings such as seasoned harusame (beanstarch vermicelli) and bamboo shoots and served with unique sweet-spicy sauce.
It is a round abura-age filled with fillings such as seasoned harusame (beanstarch vermicelli) and bamboo shoots and served with unique sweet-spicy sauce.
